page.title: 18Wildlife in the area
page.content: Brown Hare Very common in the area. Lives in the open fields. Shelters in a "form". Eats almost any type of vegetation. Mountain Hare Cousin of above - lives mainly on higher ground but often seen foraging in fields. Fur changes to white in winter. Rabbits Very common resident. Usually found in areas of loose sandy soil. Fox Known in Scotland as the Tod. Larger and heavier than the red fox of England. Very common in the area but rarely seen due to its nocturnal habits. A predator which will take any kind of animal or bird it can find including carrion.
